content: If you shop on your phone, Amazon offers 2 coupons if you download the app: one coupon for first purchase, and as a coupon for second purchase. When you download the app and press to get the coupon, it says, "coupon unlocked", but there is never a discount that appears off your order. I have tried this twice, so again I'm deleting this app. I don't recommend it, because it's just as easy to shop on your phone without the app.

This app wouldn't update and I would constantly get notifications that it would work better with the update. So after a month I decided to Uninstal and re-download as a chance for it to update properly. The app now refuses to re-download and it's been over 2 weeks. I've sent constant feedback to Amazon and Samsung and nothing has been done. I've restarted my phone, updated everything but no progress.

App is unresponsive a lot of times. When shopping for a specific sized item that isn't typically listed on the main page, I try selecting "view all options" for said item and it just jumps me right back to the top of the page and won't open the "view all options" page at all. Viewing product images is sub par at best. You have to swipe 100 times before it will actually go to the next image, and a lot of times it'll skip right over multiple images. Super frustrating!!!

Every log-on, I am asked by Amazon if I want to join PRIME. After declining several hundred times, you might think, Amazon would get a clue. Until they do get a clue, I am doing my primary shopping somewhere else. Also, the new app is NOT better. I just have to get used to it again to find all the options because the designers think moving the buttons to different locations on the screen makes it look better.

I decided to remove the music & shopping app from my android. In the past, they were great. This year, the quality has gone down, as has the price competitiveness. The shopping app told me I can no longer purchase music on my phone (no idea why) & this being the latest issue, along with not being allowed to review my purchases (I purchase items almost every day), I've decided to price comparison & go with locals when possible. As for music, if I continue to have issues, may default to others.

With a recent update, the orders page now refreshes every time you return to it, which makes checking on your orders tedious and confusing. The cart page is buggy now too, often taking you to a recent search instead of to your cart. And half the time when you tap in the search field to edit a search, it clears the field instead. When you're trying to read a product page, there's a floating back-to-top button right in the middle of your view. Usability was never great but it keeps getting worse.

PLEASE STOP moving and reconfiguring the account and orders functions in this app. Rearranging everything is a terrible practice in UX. I feel like once a month you guys have a new UX person take the lead and they feel like they need to make a mark quickly so they just rearrange everything. I would not be surprised if I found the rectangle buttons replaced with triangles and all of the text in upside down comic sans. Please PLEASE stop.

It functions, but as I am browsing products I would much rather do it on my browser as the app does not allow me to open more tabs, thus limiting me to only looking at one product at a time. When I have multiple tabs I can easily flip between a few products I am interested in to compare them. I really only keep the app around in case I need to talk to customer service.

AND......with all the rotten reviews, i have disabled this app as i have no option to completely delete it from my phone or the universe! I only use my desktop for shopping/buying: more power and better ability to control what's going on. What a waste of brain power with phone apps! 3/4's of what is on my phone I've either removed or disabled. ANYWAY......we all pay good money to be driven crazy, so just trying to stay in control to avoid a crash & burn!

The live video feature on the deals page is slowing the app down. The feature is on autoplay. The only way to shut this feature off is to click on the live video and pause it then exit the video. Please add an option to disable autoplay. This would make the app a little more user friendly and prevent data loss for those not connected to wifi. Some users may like the live video. It is fine to have it on by default or even have a want to join the live steam bar for redesign. But let users choose.

Literally every time I used the app on my old phone, I'd be searching and clicking through the options, and a "Sorry, something went wrong" message came up, which then makes you reload everything and try again. Got a brand new phone this year, works slightly better, but still get the message constantly. Very annoying when it's every other search or click, and it's been like this for long enough that I think a fix is past due.

Just downloaded the update after delaying as long as possible and, of course, the update is terrible. The account and menu pages don't load, images don't load when you want to expand them. If you just want to search something you know you want and buy it, use it. If you want to manage your account, you'll have to go through a browser. Uninstalled, it's just not worth the headache and data exposure.

There are a few things I'd change. The "this or that" button placement is no good. I keep making a selection without meaning to while I'm scrolling down to view it. I notice that the preferred option is always the option on the right, may be an issue im not alone in experiencing. Some of the aspects of the Amazon account can only be managed from a desktop/laptop web browser still.... its 2022... Many of the features used to manage the account still feel hidden away in the app.

Delayed as long as possible before updating to this piece of garbage. New version sucks. It loads very slow. It does not have next page when browsing but instead has a stupid "try again" on the bottom, and it loads previous page over and over instead of giving you other product to look at or compare to. It works well on tablet but not my phone. It sometimes make my phone run hot too. Amazon do take this piece of crop back and give us back the previous version or give option to revert back.

Amazon WAS good for a couple years, mostly with their fast free shipping and stuff BUT Amazon is slipping, hard and fast (that's what she said). Next day delivery has not worked for me that last 5 times, I am a prime member, it ends up being late then later then later until I cancel it, reorder, & it fixs it. If they lose a package in transit they should just fix it for u instead of telling u later and later. EBAY IS WAYYYYY BETTER AND CHEAPER AND $ BACK GUARANTEE! Not once had an ebay problem.

The latest update will not pull up search results by scanning bar codes. Rendering the app useless unless we want to stand there typing in search terms and then scrolling to find the product. I can type into Chrome just as easy and find listing a variety of sites. They added Shop the Look which is useless for us that don't shop for clothes.

The app is not great. When you click on "subscribe and save" it doesnt show you the products that you have subscribed to save, it just advertises products. Also there is no option to contact a seller after buying or returning an item. You can review a seller but not contact them. Also constant emails are very annoying. Every thing I order equals a new email I have to receive. There should be an option to turn off emails for orders and shipping information. This needs updating

I don't know what they did in this update, but the app is terrible now. It's almost unusable - it kept saying they were experiencing errors when I tried to place an order after this last update. It took several tries. Now, when I try to check on the status of an order, it gives the "Oops, something went wrong with this page," error. It's been several days. I hope someone is aware and fixing this...I've been a Prime customer for almost a decade and have never had so many problems.

Slow at the best of times, crashes when it wants to be more annoying. One would be safe to assume that the most current interation of a product would be, at the very least, an upgrade of the previous few product it was replacing but do not expect that from this app as of June 1, 2022. Preferably, it would be the best out of the entire line, but that would be asking too much. Heck, I would even take something developed by a teen "dark web hacker" over whatever this thing is. Thank you Amazon.

Why can't I buy albums from the app anymore? If you're gonna force me into the music app, at least let me sample/buy from it... the music app sucks and just starts a "radio" station. Now I gotta use work-arounds, and I still end up with 5 extra steps to buy new albums. Also, downloading music to my phone puts it in some phantom folder in my phone, unable to be accessed by any other app I like to use. I bought the music, let me use it.

It's difficult to filter and find exactly what you want, the ratings are screwed (bad reviews get marked out due to "Amazon Fulfillment"), deceptive titles, and all the manufacturers I've never heard of before. Free returns used to be a guarantee but now it's just a haste. Sadly I'm reverting back to in person shopping just to know what I'm buying is what I actually wanted.

I have not been able to go to home inorder to get information on customer services, because my orders are not being delivered in a timely manner and sometimes not at all. I have never encountered such terrible delivery service and especially since you are paying for it through their Prime program. It is my worst nightmare since I can't get this delivery problem straight with Amazon going on 1 1/2 years now. I now do most of my shopping with Walmart never had a delivery problem with them.

Great app! Works really well, the only thing I would hope for it to have in the future is definitely dark mode! Whenever its night and I think of something I need to add to my cart it would help a lot if my eyes didn't burn. The only other complaint I have is the video playback on products, they are low quality and won't load half the time or stutter in the middle. Other than that just a few changes in the ui to make it look more modern would be appreciated.

The Amazon App has suddenly stopped showing all previous orders and none of my wish lists show. I can see all this if I go through a web browser so I know it's not my account, it's an App problem. This happened suddenly whilst the app was open and I was doing a search. After looking around the App it turns out that my location had been switched to the USA even though I hadn't done that. Once I switched my country back to the UK, everything came back. Talk about a glitch.

Sends promotions via notifications even if you don't have Amazon Smile enabled, and they're in the same notification channel as everything else so you can't selectively disable them. Before I uninstalled it for that reason, it was miserably slow and unintuitive to use. Just use the mobile site instead, and then you can also use Amazon Smile without subjecting yourself to advertising push notifications.

The complete reload of the app based on location while I'm in the middle of shopping drives me crazy. Also, when looking at a product with multiple options, clicking on an option that is not default never loads the images. Also to look at your orders you have to wait 5-10 seconds for the page with a million links to load before the orders button appears. And now the super annoying Alexa popup every time I look at a product. They just keep making this app into a larger and larger garbage pile.

Do not update. I updated this app and now there's a Amazon echo button at the lower right side of the screen that i constantly press by mistake and i don't know how to get rid of. It's extremely annoying. I don't know why Amazon keeps trying to shove alexa down our throats. Now i can't print return labels from the app. It automatically takes me to the desktop site which tells me that my printer isn't encrypted so it won't print the label. Thanks Amazon

I wish the app would work. I can never access my account page unless I refresh the app by closing and reopening a few times, and the lag is ridiculous. Makes me just use Amazon in my web browser. /: And I wish there were a dark mode for light sensitive folks. This isn't a reason for the low review just a random additional issue I have with the app. What makes me give it such a low rating is that the app is barely functionable 85% of the time, and 85% might be a bit of a stretch.

Customer service is difficult and infuriating. I love the user experience that this app provides, but ever since I got a new number I haven't been able to reset it. I've tried disabling the two factor authentication, it still wants me to verify my identity with only my phone number. It would be completely fine if I could verify with my email, but unfortunately, no such luck. I've called customer service multiple times, I still cannot access my account.

Pissed beyond belief. Spent hours on a shipping list then at the last second Amazon changed my payment method then wouldn't let me change it back. So I had to cancel the order to change it. Well that wiped all traces of the entire order completely and made me have to start over. Prime cancelled. Never ordering from Amazon again. Hint: maybe when someone selects "change payment method" it doesn't mean they want to completely erase their order with no chance of retrieving it, geniuses.

Looping through the same options when im trying to return an item is extremely draining. Been waiting almost two months. Says its lost. Cant get to a point of actually returning or refunding cause it just says speak to the seller. Amazons the seller. Talk to customer support. Which item. Talk to seller. Amazons the seller. Which item. Talk to the seller....awful experience. At very least it is overwhelmingly discouraging. So appearantly im just out 300. Guess ill just kick rocks

Not getting Shipment Notifications. I have checked everything in the app for shipment notifications. I used to get notification for all shipments up until about 2 weeks ago. Now there are no more texts to let me know when the shipment is on the way, within 10 stops, or that it has been delivered. I have looked at every setting and I've reset everything, but I'm still not getting notifications that the shipment is going to arrive or that it's been delivered. Do I need to uninstall and reinstall?

Error keeps popping up indicatiing the app has stopped, especially while other apps are being used like Waze which makes it dangerous because the Amazon message covers the Waze up while driving. You get an error message over whatever app is open. Tried everything to correct this, nothing fixes it. Also, app is extremely slow especially when trying to access order info or lists.

The live streams are super anoying and start playing when you are just trying to scroll past. Also, wishlists are super buggy. 500 words is not enough space to list everything wrong with them. They often jump back to the top or skip around while scrolling. Items appear duplicated (but are not, so don't delete them!) And an icon of a long removed item is still the default list image... There are about 15 other bugs as well.

This app is like going back in time. It both looks and feels dated. Scrolling does not work properly and once you've decided to continue you purchase Amazon will make sure you can't cancel the operation in a simple way. They even hide the logout option by purpose. I also get very funny notifications like "maybe you are interested in a cake plate." What?!

Amazon bribed me to install the app, so I tried it for a minute. Every single item on all of Amazon says it "cannot be shipped to my location." Funny, things ship just fine from the browser ðŸ¤” Edit: I figured out why. It tried to autodetect my location and decided I was across the border. No apparent way to fix this. So I'm stuck shopping on the wrong country's Amazon. *slowclap*. Good job, dev team. You have my shipping address but you decided to do this instead.

I think the new changes that we can no longer purchase ebooks through the Amazon app and the Kindle app in the new upgrade is RIDICULOUS!!!! What is the point of the apps if we now have to go online just to purchase books! I don't like this new change and I'm sure I'm not the only one that finds it annoying and inconvenient. On the apps I can just purchase a book right away. SMH

Keeps erroring out. Every time I have brought this app up for the past couple of months I get a picture of a dog and something says uh-oh, it looks like something went wrong on our end. Well how about you guys fix your end? I've reinstalled the app several times and it still doesn't work. Get your stuff together. EDIT: A month later and it still doesn't work right. Won't work on my phone for more than a few seconds, and I even tried installing it on my Chromebook and got the same result.

Can't view my orders. For a few weeks, it's been hit and miss if I get to see the orders list page which. Its getting annoying as I use that page to check when an item is arriving or to rebuy things I've bought. I've not been able to see my orders for two days solid now. It just goes to that awful dog page. Update: Contacted the developer and only received a generic email back with no mention of the problem I've had. Still not able to view the order page.

Unable to change between countries. I move between two countries, and have family and friends in two others, with accounts in each country. I used to be able to change between locations, now the app has me locked to one country, and it is not of use for the foreseeable future! Please update so we can switch between countries like we used to be able to.

I have been a Prime member for years. I have a suggestion to improve the app. When I am shopping, I like to look at colors of different items next to each other to color coordinate. It is very hard to tell if items match each other. Such as do these multi colored pants go with this shade of red. Or do these outdoor chair cushions match the tablecloth I have picked out. If there was a way to drag the item in the cart up and down to place them next to each other it would be helpful.

Need to be able to add more info in additional delivery instructions. As for some odd reason delivery drivers do not even attempt to deliver to my address (even though they lie and say they have). I live in an apartment block with concierge at main reception, CCTV throughout the building, plus I have a Google doorbell. Yes there are several entrances, but only 1 for the public. So would be good to be able to post a picture stating where the entrance is like other delivery apps do.

Not intuitive interface, worse than the old. Once you type anything in Search, it's impossible to delete it, only overwrite with something else. Somehow, the app started pointing to my US site, it was absolutely impossible to re-point it back to Oz, amazon help desk was useless. Had to uninstall and install again.

Worst customer service ever! I just moved to an apartment that has an amazon hub, I have placed four orders and each time they did not provide a locker code. Each time I contacted support and had to jump through hoops each step of the way. The third time they assured me the issue would be fixed and it wasn't fourth time, the agent told me to get back to them when I was near the hub. I promptly asked for a refund and they just lost a customer.

The app is very well laid out. I find it very easy to find exactly what I am looking for. My shopping from beginning to end is done in under a minute or 2. Amazon is my go to for just about everything strictly because of ease of use and expedience. The only area that I get frustrated with is trying to locate my subscriptions to streaming services. It is somewhat hidden, and you can't cancel a service from your phone. I find this to go against my usual customer experience with Amazon.

I love it. Lots of items and they are (for most of them) cheaper than any grocery/stores. They deliver and you get an app to watch movies. Great When I have the wrong package or a damaged one or even the wrong color one they are easy to reach back and they understand. They are helping and assisting you. I seriously think this is one of the most honest and responsive online business there is up to date.

On the latest update using your mobile it is too easy to swip right and delete the content of any basket, there is no way recover the accidentally deleted items or turn this rediculous option off! The filter button are useless, the searches are now very poor! Previously you could use wildcards i.e '-' indicating that you did not want a result containing 'x'. Now I just give up, the search gives you endless items not related to the original search.

No customer service. I don't speak spanish. My app has all the sudden turned all the listings to Spanish. I go to settings and reset to United States and language English. I then click "done" . It then takes me to home page and it is still Spanish. I sent an email to the address they give on this page and only got an automated response about taking my advice and forwarding it to development team for next update. Stupid! I just want my prime account fixed so I can use it.

Help! Whenever I open a product to look at it on the app, it doesn't show me the pictures of the product, and then I can't push the back button on my phone. It won't let me. It just gives me a blank screen until I force the app to quit and then restart. And then it does it again when I restart it ðŸ˜• This has just started with the past 2 app updates.

Worst App upgrade ever. In the past selecting the prime service was smooth and easy. Now you can't. Now if you want prime, you need to go on the desktop to select prime. Who carries a desktop pc with them on train or bus. Amazon should sack/fire the idiot who did this update and ruined the App. Oh by the way did you notice that when you are trying to make a purchase, check the url. It take you to a fraudulent website. I would be very careful make a purchase. The App does not look safe at all.

This app has never let me down in terms of usefulness. However, as of the most recent update (06/20/22) it is frequently giving me error screens (you know, the ones with the dogs). It at first was just with my orders screen but now it is with most of the app sans a few screens. As I said at first, the app had been incredibly useful, but has recently gotten unusable.

App is stale, slow, buggy and useless compared to website... For example you can't add delivery to "Amazon lockers" through the app. Not to mention the ads, search, dark mode are all major issues. Oh and data consumption is terrible, what is this app doing in the background? I'll continue to use the website until it also becomes useless. Sure that'll be soon, seems to be hundreds of pages of the same Chinese products now, nothing different but fake brand names.

For lists on the app... when scrolling through items, when you click the heart icon, a drop box of your lists should appear so you can decide which list you'd like to add the item to. The way is set up now is stupid and useless. You should also be able to delete multiple lists at once instead of having to go into each individual list to delete.

Pretty good, but I hate the design of the product page; specifically how the customer reviews are displayed on mobile devices. The filters and options should all be easy to see and navigate to ( at the top/start of the reviews list). The fact that I have to frustratingly scroll down and look for the "See all reviews" button is not good. The button is obscured by it's location, which is squished between two lists of reviews, and the color scheme. If this is intentional then I ponder why.

Not at all as convenient as it used to be. Don't have a complete history of stuff you ordered, wish list constantly freezes every time you try to remove something, no dark mode, etc. But worst of all, is it will straight up refuse to load if you have a VPN active. No joke. So if you're a privacy-minded person just know that Amazon 100% does not support you.

EDIT: I dropped two stars in 2022 when Google Play stopped letting me purchase my Kindle books IN my Amazon app. This is asinine stupid. WHY do I have to go to my browser on my phone to purchase a Kindle book?? Put it back. FIX THIS GOOGLE PLAY! THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE. Amazon Shopping is EXTREMELY easy to use. It keeps track of all my Amazon transactions for me, and also has wish lists...actually, it's just like that website only ten times easier to view and maneuver around in. Quicker, too.

Disbaling the ability to purchase Kindle books through the app is a horrible design change. As a user, I don't want to waste my time logging into Amazon from a web browser just to buy a an ebook. More steps to purchase means I'm going to purchase less books. Hopefully whatever issue Google has with this feature can be resolved because it's not in the best interest of the consumer.

Ordered a large picture frame. It cost over 1/4th of my paycheck. Said it was delivered, so I looked outside. Not there. It was delivered to someone else in another town. I tried to get a hold of them ended up talking to a robot. I wanted at least a refund, but I couldn't do that without returning the picture frame, which I don't have. I hate giving negative reviews, but this isn't the first time it has happened on other accounts. If I could give 0 stars I would.

Good app with a seriously annoying issue. Whilst scrolling, it's far too easy for the app to detect a 'scroll swipe' as 'tapping on a product'. This has (literally) every 10 seconds or so... maybe even more whilst scrolling. It will show me a product I did not want to view. That's my only issue but it's been driving me crazy.

I've had a lot of positive experiences with Amazon but the bad experiences outweigh. I never received a package and hundreds of messages back and forth and hours on the phone with various customer service nothing was ever handled. For months I was strung along waiting for call backs and "investigations." Customer service was always sympathetic but never actually did anything. I sat on the phone with someone for 3 hours only for them to tell me they'd get it worked out and nothing.

I would recommend this app for shopping. However one complaint I would like to address is that it is very hard to change your language in the app because the settings don't make it clear. You can't change your language back to English if you looked at a page from a different country and you can't change it back unless if you say "Alexa, change my language" or if you log out and sign back in. Changing a laguange shouldn't be this hard for the app, and the Options layouts need to be fixed.

I love shopping and Amazon definitely makes it much easier. 98.5% of the time I find exactly what I'm looking for and shipping is also timely. I really appreciate that they have so many tools for you to ensure that the item you want is really what your looking for. My favorite part are the reviews, where buyers can express with honesty details about their experience with items quality, functionality, longevity etc. I spend hours searching and saving items for when I'm ready to buy. It's awesom

becoming a prime member is the best value for money in my opinion ,you can buy pretty much anything you can think of plus free posting/ returns also good TV programs and films and a good selection of books/magazines that change monthly + music. + all the above is available on multiple devices that you own and is always with you. I could go on but I think you get the point. in my opinion a must have utility for all your needs..

Delivery services are bad. Over half my orders have been delivered to the wrong address. It's very embarrassing and inconvenient to have to walk around a complex searching on other people's doorsteps for my items. It also causes neighbors to be uncomfortable like I'm looking to steal or snoop. It's extremely inconvenient to pay the prime membership every month yet have to go hunting for my packages. It's frustrating to have to reorder items and get in contact with Amazon customer service.

same issue happening with the prime app , I bought an item through the shopping app and then subscribed to the prime video in order to watch the new season of the boys , now it has declined my last order through shopping and locked me out of both accounts , it gives you an option to switch countries telling you that might solve the issue but it doesn't do anything , it just loads for a second and gives you the option again ,you tried to contact customer service? You need to be logged in... BS

I think the user experience with this app is a downgrade from using my smartphone's browser. I hate that when I go to Amazon in my browser it forces me over to this app. I hate that in order to use Amazon support chat I have to install the app. Also I think the interface color is ugly. You might like it. It's almost turquoise, but not quite. And ugh! Unrequested notifications about products I "might like" Just no!

I am furious... Amazon shoving Alexa down my throat, having to put up with the"drop in" on my screen both on phone and tablet. I don't like Alexa, I don't ever plan on using it. The stupid icon gets in my way and if you touch it, it wastes time by bringing up the screen to activate my microphone... Like I am ever going to do that! Maybe they ought to consider allowing users to opt out? Nah... That'd be too user friendly.

This is one of the WORST apps I have ever installed!!! It is slow, locks up repeatedly, making me sign in over and over, and not only kicks me out of the app, but sends me to my home screen. I will never reinstall it. Don't waste your time with this app, just use Amazon's website.

Language is key for finding stuff. And I find it frustrating that the app has none. I need to disable the app, eneble and update it once in a while because it keeps changing from english to french. I did not ask for that. I did not change it to french. IDGAF about Quebec's provical law about engilsh or french. My personal preferences and personal... for the bilions Amazon is worth, I think having language preferrences available in app something easy to do, it's a minimum, you own to your users.

Overall not bad but some of the Seller's could use more scrutiny because a lot of them don't even have possession of the items and when they sell an item more than once of something at the price and then all of a sudden they don't have it they'll trick you by giving you someone else's shipping information and stringing you along for 2 weeks. frankly if you don't have the item in hand you don't need to be allowed to be a seller you should have to prove it by the serial number and model number

Terrible app. Amazon won't give support without this app, yet this app doesn't work!? So they've charged me for products that they've not delivered, and then made it almost impossible to contact them. I've reinstalled this app multiple times, but not once has it logged in, every time I try the app crashes and tells me to log in again. This is what happens when big companies habe no competition, they get greedy and lazy, nothing but disgusting thieves now.

I hate Amazon, Prime, my stupid echo show... Useless plastic, cannot stay connected via blue tooth for more than an hour, cuts in and out, has literally made demonic static noises during a time when a calm environment is essential. It just can't function properly with Spotify. I can't leave a review on Amazon for the echo because I got it as a gift and am not allowed to review because I don't "meet their criteria". Glad I got it for a gift and didn't spend my own money on it.

After being forced to update the app to actually be allowed(!) to use it. I did, only to find to my horror that all of my 20 year history, address details, suggested items, wish list and much more have disappeared. What have you done Amazon?? Please revert to the previous version while you correct this major issue, and please please ensure it works before you release it again. I feel lost. After reading the most recent reviews I see I'm by no means alone. What are you doing? Get it fixed ASAP!

even when i inputs the vehicles in my amazon garage, Amazon finds and even suggests parts that do not even match my vehicles. what's the point. one has to do alot of work to find the right parts. and even then, some get returned do to not a match. Lastly, reviews are such fakes. Can't even filter the fluff and only see confirmed purchases.

It's definitely my go-to shopping app. I buy pretty much everything for daily usage from Amazon. And whenever I need something. Because it's so fast. And we got a new Amazon fulfillment center built nearby. So much so, I've been with Amazon for over 20 years since it's just an online bookstore and I needed used college textbooks. No matter what other would say, since Amazon is getting indispensable to me, the app, of course, is helpful.

No way to get rid of the alexa button, no way to edit alexa settings, not even by following the instructions. Impossible to clean up recommended lists. Constantly refreshes and you lose your place. Photos don't load. Videos don't load. Surveys cast votes just by scrolling past, no pics or text, so I don't even know what I accidentally voted on.

Asked if i want to try prime every time i open the app. When i finally decide sure theres a few shows i want to watch, i get a message - can't be done in the mobile app. The general point of mobile apps it to make it easier for users to do eveything all in one spot, not make it so they have to use multiple platforms to do one task. Thank you amazon, I was going to impulse-buy your overly-expensive subscription service, but you stopped me and gave me time to think twice.

Latest version doesn't work for me. Can't view home, orders or lists. Eventually it times out with error message, a nice dog picture or returns to original page.
